title: A Cautionary Advice To A Young Friend
text:
A Cautionary Advice To A Young Friend

Proverbs 30

KJV

17+ The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

 

Many of us the aged have for friends some young men and women. Occasionally we meet and interact, and we tell one another ‚ÄúWhat was and  what is!‚Äù

 

Generations differ no one doubts this, however, some principles don‚Äôt change with generational change. 

 

The rate at which societal values are changing has been a source of worry and concern to the older generation! In a conversation with a young friend, this issue came up. 

 

The conclusion we both came up with was ‚Äú somebody ( a generation) went to sleep‚Äù A generation failed to uphold and pass on to the other what it received. It is this failure that has brought us to where we are today! The question was How do we then reset the clock? 

 

We see and experience these in every sphere of life be it social, church, family or national. Had the failed generation followed the principle of transferring to others what it received we would have maintain high moral and ethical standards and sanity. 

 

Just like the Church we have kept and observe the Lord‚Äôs Supper because, as Paul said ; 

Corinthians 11

KJV

23+ For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread:

 

We have passed on to us values that have kept past generations sound, united, responsive and respectful. Today all these have crumbled before our very eyes. This is a laissez-faire generation! 

 

The sages of old have always held as sacrosanct this commandment;

Proverbs 23

KJV

22+ Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

 

Proverbs 1

KJV

8+ My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

 

Ephesians 6

KJV

1+ Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

2+ Honour thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;)

 

What do we see today? 

 

Proverbs 30

KJV

11+ There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

 

Proverbs 30

KJV

12+ There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

 

Yes, the ‚Äúold order changeth‚Äù, but eternal laws/principles, truths etc remain the same. These are what is called the ‚Äú eternal non-negotiable principles and laws‚Äù

 

One of which is respect for the elderly, in whom reside refined quality thought, wisdom and common sense as a result of experience gathered through life!

 

If only we could all pay attention to this warning, our journey would be smooth and end well!  

Proverbs 20

KJV

20+ Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

 

Every generation was once a youthful generation, blessed are those who recognize that progress and success lie in the degree and extent to which they treat those who were before them.

 

Everything is an inheritance, a transference from one generation to the other. What have you inherited? And from whom? Your deeds etc will reveal what you inherited and from whom! 

 

Eyes are watching l! 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Wicked Heart
text:
A Wicked Heart

Proverbs 24

KJV

29+ Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

 

Proverbs 3

KJV

28+ Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

 

A wicked heart is difficult to define but is noted ( identified ) by some of the characteristics indicated in the above scripture passages. The contents of a wicked heart are seen through deeds. 

 

It is a heart that conceives, plans and executes evil as if it were for fun! A wicked heart is a heart that rejoices and stands aloof when others suffer. It is self-centred. 

 

It is also a heart full of vengeance, that knows no forgiveness unless he has paid back evil with evil. It is a vindictive heart! It is a hypocritical, pretentious heart that laughs /smiles but will stab at the first opportunity it gets  

 

Read the psalmist‚Äôs experience which he captured in these vivid words; 

 

Psalm 41:6,9

NIV

[6] When one of them comes to see me, he speaks falsely, while his heart gathers slander; then he goes out and spreads it around. [9] Even my close friend, someone I trusted, one who shared my bread, has turned against me.

 

A wicked heart is that heart that shops and bargains ready to sell when the price offered is right. 

 

Though we live, work and walk with people with wicked hearts, there is not much that we can do except to watch, pray and hide under the protective canopy of God.

 

May we continuously search and know the type of heart we have as we are told the heart can be deceptive. 

 

Jeremiah 17

KJV

9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: When The Tongue Is A Pen
text:
Psalms 45
KJV
1+ My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

 

Psalm 45:1 
NIV
[1] My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.

 

Like me, I am sure  you don‚Äôt know, nor has it ever occurred to you that the ‚Äú  tongue is a pen!‚Äù

 

I found this verse very interesting especially as it described the ‚Äútongue‚Äù as a pen!  ‚ÄúMy tongue is the pen of a skillful writer‚Äù!

 

Indeed some speak just as they write; this is a gift. Very skillful in their choices of words either spoken or written. It is always a delight to hear them speak or read what they write

 

To speak therefore is the same as to write with a pen,  one is audible the other silent, they all have the same audience!

 

Words spoken or written can be classified into two categories: wise and unwise. They can make or break the spirit of their hearers or readers.

 

Therefore heed this admonition; 
Proverbs 25
KJV
11+ A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

Proverbs 15:23 
NIV
[23] A person finds joy in giving an apt reply---and how good is a timely word!

 

Timely words are very important, read how Isaiah puts it ;  

Isaiah 50
KJV
4+ The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he wakeneth morning by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.

Words whether spoken or written live forever in the minds of both hearers and readers. Their effects may be forgiven or forgotten but not the words.

 

On a practical note, I‚Äôve had many referring me to things I‚Äôve said or written before. Some in context others taken out of context!

 

It is also important to note that the words we speak or write will be recalled on the Day of Judgment as testimonies for or against us.

 

Matthew 12
KJV
36 But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.

37+ For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

James also warned ; 


James 3:1-2 
NIV
[1] Not many of you should become teachers, my fellow believers, because you know that we who teach will be judged more strictly.

[2] We all stumble in many ways. Anyone who is never at fault in what they say is perfect, able to keep their whole body in check.

 

So, beloved choose your words, do your best to let them be appropriate and relevant to the occasion. Be measured and economical in the use of words; either spoken or written.

 

The tongue is a pen, use it wisely! In writing we think through before we put any word on paper, in like manner train your tongue to weigh words before they are uttered.

 

The careless use of words has caused many a relationship, either friendship or marriage.

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: The World Shall Hear Of Me Again
text:
Acts 1
KJV
11+ Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

 

This was said many centuries ago and has remained the main hope and expectation of all believers! 
Can it truly be said that we await with preparation and expectation,  His second coming?  

 

When was the last time you heard a sermon on The Second Coming? It has been assumed and therefore pushed to the back burner. This explains why the faith of many has grown cold because they‚Äôve lost appetite for heaven. Hmmm

 

Rereading these scriptures brought to mind the famous statement often heard at the end of every Fu Manchu film series from the lips of popular actor Christopher Lee, aka Fu Manchu!

 

In our youth (1960/70) we watched a series of films depicting a notorious underworld figure called Fu Manchu. Though at the end of every series he would be caught, yet before the film is brought to a close he would appear and utter the words ‚Äú the world shall hear of me again‚Äù

 

As naive as we then were, this statement from Fu Manchu frightens us because we see him appear in another episode; we often wonder how he could reappear after his death! Truly, It is great to be young!

 

Reading what the angel told the disciples should remind us that  ‚Äú 
this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.‚Äù

 

This means Jesus will return in a physical form and not as a spirit as some claim and will be seen by all! What is unknown is the when! The ‚Äòhow‚Äô we know, the ‚Äòwhere He will come from‚Äô  we know.

 

Have you thought about this? On that day a great mystery shall be solved as we shall see Him as He is! Whether white, black, yellow-skinned etc we don‚Äôt know. That day and hour shall declare! Truly we look forward to that day and His appearance.

 

Beloved, since we don‚Äôt know the ‚Äúwhen‚Äù let each be always ready so His return does not take him/her unaware. The question that should be of great concern  is where will He find us? In what state or condition? Peaceful or angry, loving or hating? Etc. Think about this.

 

This question worried Fanny J Crosby (1820-1915)  a blind songwriter which led her to write this hymn ;

 

1.    When Jesus comes to reward His servants,
Whether it be noon or night,
Faithful to Him will He find us watching,
With our lamps all trimmed and bright?

 

(Oh, can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready for the soul‚Äôs bright home?
Say, will He find you and me still watching,
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come?)

 

2
If at the dawn of the early morning,
He shall call us one by one,
When to the Lord we restore our talents,
Will He answer thee‚ÄîWell done?

 

3
Have we been true to the trust He left us?
Do we seek to do our best?
If in our hearts there is naught condemns us,
We shall have a glorious rest.

 

4
Blessed are those whom the Lord finds watching,
In His glory they shall share;
If He shall come at the dawn or midnight,
Will He find us watching there?

 

How do we answer these questions? Yes, the world shall hear of Him again?

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Teach Yourself How To Walk In The Truth
text:
(series 5)
3 John 1
KJV
3 For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.
4+ I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

Life‚Äôs lessons are taught by following a systematically arranged curriculum or through experience. There is ‚Äú systematic truth ‚Äú and ‚Äú experiential Truth‚Äù.

The pursuit of both is recommended and desirable, but the experiential is the most preferred. An effective, useful, and successful person possesses the combination of both classroom and street ( experiential) sense!

As the psalmist requested, truth must be taught ;
Psalms 86
KJV
11+ Teach me thy way, O Lord; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

In the case of Christianity, an effective useful child of God is the one who not only knows the scriptures ( theoretical) but can apply them in the real world It is not about ‚Äú quotation ‚Äú it is about ‚Äú application‚Äù.

Two things are highlighted in the above scripture passages, ‚Äúto walk in the truth‚Äù and ‚Äúto walk in truth‚Äù. The two statements are not the same.

The first presupposes that there is a body of knowledge called ‚Äú the truth ‚Äú which one must uphold and apply to be described as ‚Äú walking in the truth‚Äù

To live and do things as stated in the scriptures is to ‚Äú walk in the truth as scripture is the Truth
John 17
KJV
17+ Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

The question we must ask ourselves daily is ‚ÄúAre we walking in the truth?‚Äù Are we living lives that are consistent and in conformity with the Truth?‚Äù The Word.

The second thought conveyed in the verses above is ‚Äú walking in truth‚Äù To walk In Truth is simply to be sincere, honest, to be a promise keeper, reliable, trustworthy, your word is your bond. One word sums it up ‚Äú principled‚Äù.

To walk in the teeth gladdens the heart of God and fellow man. The Apostle John could not hide his joy when he saw and experienced the life of the children of a Christian sister.

2 John 1
KJV
4+ I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father.

When the knowledge of the Word of God influences us it makes us walk in truth. We deal sincerely and honestly with people as we live principled lives.

Interestingly, it is only fellow principled people who see this and admire the principled. The unprincipled finds it difficult to understand let alone accept them!

Yes, darkness and light can not coexist. The vulgar, rude, uncouth etc can not coexist with the disciplined, decent-minded, orderly etc. We see these every day as we relate to people.

Ever wondered why some disliked, speak evil of you, why your presence in their midst disturbs them etc? It is because you Walk In Truth. You call a spade a spade and not a shovel You are principled!

Read God‚Äôs promise to the principled, those who walk in truth ;
1 Kings 2
KJV
4+ That the Lord may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.

Beloved, teach yourself how to walk not only in the truth but also in truth!

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Don‚Äôt Let The Green Grass Fool You!
text:
Genesis 13
KJV
10+ And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.

A few reading the heading to this article will recall it is the title of a popular song sang by the late legendary ‚Äúsoul icon ‚Äú Wilson Pickett; in our time we had singers whose songs meant a lot their words were full of wisdom.

Wilson Pickett visited Ghana in the company of the Jackson Five ( Michael Jackson and his brothers), Staple Singers, and several other top-flight soul groups, If my memory serves me right I think Ike and Tina Turner were part to entertain Ghanaians at the Independence Square. It was a night to remember!

The program was arranged such that Wilson Pickett was to appear on stage exactly at midnight; which he did wearing a black slack with silver buttons that flashed dazzlingly. Guess what, he came on stage as the hour struck midnight with his evergreen song ‚Äú Midnight Hour!‚Äú

The crowd yelled and surged forward as he spoke the first words of the song ‚Äú Am gonna wait till the midnight hour‚Äù. And he did! It was a scene best seen/experienced rather than told/described. That was Ghana then!

Beloved, the mistakes many have made ( and are still making) in life can be attributed to the exercise of poor judgment. Like Lot, many have allowed the ‚Äú green grass ‚Äúto fool them. As the scriptures said,
‚ÄúAnd Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where,‚Äù. Lot was undiscerning! He did what is described today as ‚Äú failure to read between the lines‚Äù.

Oh, how many an undiscerning youth have lifted their eyes and beheld all the fake, pretentious lives of glamour that celebrities portray on tv and other social media handles , and thought they are real. Only to be disappointed with the passage of time.

Yes, do not let the fake green grass fool you. In use in Ghana today is an imitated synthetic made ‚Äúgreen grass‚Äù used mostly to decorate event grounds.

For a natural ‚Äúgreen grass‚Äù to last long and not die/dry easily the soil must be well prepared, which activity takes time. It also requires regular maintenance . Beloved, for a success to last long, it would require a deliberate, conscious effort and preparation . One must be willing to invest, work hard and wait patiently.

There are many today who are in life‚Äôs scrap yard , gnashing their teeth because they were fooled by the ‚Äú green grass‚Äù !

Scripture is true, read a few ;
Proverbs 13
KJV
11+ Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

Proverbs 20
KJV
21+ An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

Proverbs 28
KJV
20+ A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

Proverbs 28
KJV
22+ He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

The grass is not green everywhere, therefore be discerning ! Like , Lot don‚Äôt let the green grass fool you.

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: He Said It, And He Did It
text:
Luke 24
KJV
7+ Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

Unlike political candidates who say many things but are unable to fulfil them, all that Jesus said about himself, and what He will do or be done to Him were all fulfilled. He was an amazing Man of His Words who must be taken seriously.

One such prediction is what you‚Äôve read; that He will be betrayed, condemned and crucified and on the third day shall rise again.

When He first said these many were those who doubted Him, made mockery and ridiculed Him, but it came to pass.

In the early hours of the First Day of the week, the city of Jerusalem woke up to ‚Äú breaking news ! ‚Äù.

Three women on a fact-finding mission to the cemetery where He was buried met with an empty tomb. They hurried back to town to gossip their findings to a few. They gossiped because they were afraid.

But as is normal with gossip no sooner had they whispered this to a few than it became news that went viral.

Reporters and stringers from the Jerusalem Chronicle, Jerusalem FM John 3:16, Pilate FM, Matthew 27:24 and sister stations within and outside the city met with these women and interviewed them live on air.

They described vividly what they saw, the rolled stone, the empty tomb, and the man dressed in white who spoke to them.

They even repeated word for word what the white-clothed man said ‚ÄúWhy seek ye the living among the dead? He has risen ‚Äú

Yes, this is the Man Jesus. One newspaper headlined the morning‚Äôs publication with the words ‚Äú He said it, and He did It!‚Äù The curious nature of the headline made the paper sold fast that by noon it has sold over several thousands.

Yes without a doubt , that Jesus died , was buried and on the third day rose again from the dead is an undeniable historical fact

We worship a risen Saviour. Upon the first day of the week as we assemble to break bread and drink of the cup let our voices and hearts rejoice And may we do it from sincere , pure and honest hearts.

And., remember he who eat and drink in an unworthy manner, ( wicked , evil , unrepentant heart) eats and drinks damnation unto himself.

Maranatha

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: ‚ÄùLow In The Grave He Lay: For So It Is Written‚Äù
text:
Psalms 16
KJV
10+ For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

This was said many centuries before it found its fulfilment in Christ! Before then many have lived in anticipation of when this prophecy will come to pass.

Yes, ‚Äú thou will not leave my soul in Hell; neither wilt thou suffer Thine Holy One To see corruption ‚Äú.
The final contest between the forces of Good and Evil, between Jesus and the Devil was that which began from His condemnation through his trial, the crucifixion on the Cross, his burial and finally ended with His resurrection!

Yes, by His resurrection He put to shame the nay-sayers, those who out of envy condemned and crucified Him thinking they had finished Him!

Yes, the same will be done to us who have pledged our loyalty to Him, our enemies, our doubters and naysayers shall humiliate and make a mockery of us!

Yes, beloved our enemies will bury us in disgrace, humiliation and dishonour! They will make our names a byword by soiling our image and reputation, but we shall rise to conquer in the end.

Just like how He rose from the dead even so shall we also rise from the depth of humiliation, disgrace and dishonor that our foes have buried us. We shall rise to fame and glory in the name of Jesus. Impossibilities shall become possible.

Yes, he who laughs last laughs best! It is the doings of the Lord, disgrace and dishonor can not keep us down; in the Name of Jesus we shall pull down the ‚Äú bars of shame ‚Äú.

A hymn writer put it this way ‚ÄúDeath can not keep its prey, he tore the bars away, up from the grave he arose with a mighty triumph over his foes, he arose a Victor from the dark domain and for forever with His saints to reign!

Yes, Low in the grave He lay Jesus, my Savior! Waiting the coming day Jesus my Lord!

Up from the grave He arose With a mighty triumph o'er His foes, He arose a Victor from the dark domain And He lives forever with His saints to reign

He arose! (He arose) He arose! (He arose) Hallelujah! Christ arose!

Vainly they watch His bed‚Äî
Jesus, my Savior!
Vainly they seal the dead‚Äî
Jesus my Lord!

Death cannot keep his prey‚Äî
Jesus, my Savior!
He tore the bars away‚Äî
Jesus my Lord!

Beloved, trust in the Risen Jesus in the face of challenges, He overcame and so will you. ‚ÄúEnemies are not God‚Äù is an inscription I saw written on a trotro bus. Only exercise patience! Jesus overcame, and you also will overcome!

Lessons I learnt from the death, burial and the resurrection of Jesus. These I share with you. He who laughs last laughs the best!

Have a blessed holiday

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: ‚ÄùThis Our Journey Of No Return‚Äù
text:
Ecclesiastes 3
KJV
22+ Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

Ask again! ‚Äúfor who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?‚Äù

It is easy to forget that this journey that we‚Äôve embarked on here on Earth is a one-way journey. We came with only a one-way return ticket. We can not return to our homes once we leave.

Our visas are one-way visas and are not renewable when they expire though under certain circumstances they can be extended but not renewed. Visa extension is discretionary and is subject to conditions set by the Issuer!

What is of great worry and concern to all travellers here is the undisclosed nature of the visas, especially their expiry date. No one knows when, where and how his visa will expire. How long we stay is undisclosed!

Though many have tried to inquire, investigate, speculate, propound theories etc; none has come out with any credible way of knowing when his/her visa will expire.

A hymn writer once said ‚ÄúThough men may search they can not find, for God alone does understand‚Äù Indeed the Issuer had stamped on the front page of our passport the following;

Deuteronomy 29:29
NIV
[29] The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may follow all the words of this law.

This was intended to warn us to desist from undertaking such inquiries and investigations!

This being the case how should we then spend our days/year‚Äôs etc.?

For the answers, we are privileged to have the memoirs of one person who knew this ‚Äúone-way ticket ‚Äú phenomenon and spent his stay in a certain way so we shall consult him to know how we ought to spend ours!

There is a warning however, it is not everything he said he did that is recommended so read with care, caution and discernment! Readers are warned!

Before his visa expired he gave a brief expose of how he saw his stay, a frustrating and disappointing picture. Read it;

Ecclesiastes 2:18-24
NIV
[18] I hated all the things I had toiled for under the sun because I must leave them to the one who comes after me.

[19] And who knows whether that person will be wise or foolish? Yet they will have control over all the fruit of my toil into which I have poured my effort and skill under the sun. This too is meaningless.

[20] So my heart began to despair over all my toilsome labor under the sun. [21] For a person may labor with wisdom, knowledge and skill, and then they must leave all they own to another who has not toiled for it. This too is meaningless and a great misfortune.

[22] What do people get for all the toil and anxious striving with which they labor under the sun? [23] All their days their work is grief and pain; even at night their minds do not rest. This too is meaningless.

Hope was not lost to him, read what he did and hence his advice;

[24] A person can do nothing better than to eat and drink and find satisfaction in their own toil. This too, I see, is from the hand of God

To conclude take note of the following; we came with a one-way return ticket. We shall not come back again. Our visas are non-renewable, even if extended they shall surely expire. As to when we are unaware. We wish we could know how many years remain on our visas!

Knowing this take his advice ;
Ecclesiastes 2:24
NIV
[24] A person can do nothing better than to eat and drink and find satisfaction in their own toil. This too, I see, is from the hand of God,

( Please do not ‚Äúmisread‚Äù or misinterpret the word ‚Äúdrink‚Äù to mean go and ‚Äú chill‚Äù you are a Ghanaian I know you ü§£)

But on a more serious note be guided by his final advice

Ecclesiastes 11
KJV
9+ Rejoice, O young man, in thy youth; and let thy heart cheer thee in the days of thy youth, and walk in the ways of thine heart, and in the sight of thine eyes: but know thou, that for all these things God will bring thee into judgment

Ecclesiastes 12
KJV
13 Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.

14+ For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil.

A holiday reading I share with you!

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Long Forgotten
text:
Ecclesiastes 9
KJV
5+ For the living know that they shall die: but the dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.

I have waited the whole day expecting to read from any tabloid what this day is noted for but to no avail.

Today 17th April 1967 was the day Lt. Gen. E.K. Kotoka died as a result of the abortive coup attempt by some junior officers of the military led by Lt. S. B. Arthur.

This took place some fifty -eight years ago! As the Bible says this event, its initiators and victims are all long forgotten!

Beloved, even so, shall we all be forgotten fifty-eight years from now. The majority living at that time will not remember us.

Life will go on as it is today with no one remembering who we were! People‚Äôs interest and attention would be as it is today on the economy, the fuel price, the exchange rate etc, and how to put food on the table.

So, enjoy and make yourself happy while you are alive today! I am going to get myself some light -soup to drink! For we brought nothing into the world and we shall certainly carry nothing away.

Nobody will remember us fifty years from now. Gen. Kotoka died on 17th April 1967 exactly 58 years today life goes on as it was before!

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: The Low Side Of Our Profession: An Observation
text:
Ephesians 4
KJV
25+ Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

Zechariah 8
KJV
16+ These are the things that ye shall do; Speak ye every man the truth to his neighbour; execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates:

One negative practice that appears to be gaining ground among professing believers is the art of lying. Yes, you read it.
Like you, I‚Äôve also asked were we born liars or we learnt them?

The ease at which lies are told with a straight face makes one wonder if lying is part of our nature. Some say it is part of our ‚Äúfallen nature‚Äù which is true!

title: What Ageing Has Taught Me: My Testimony

35+ I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

 

As I age this verse of scripture becomes more and more pronounced than before. We have used it to take the Sunday collection which is true and right but its significance can be felt as you age. 

 

I remember seeing my late mother Agnes Dede Kwawu untie the end of her outer cloth to give her last pesewa to us though we could see she needed it. I‚Äôve seen my dad do a similar thing to my younger sisters. It is now that I can fully grasp the reason and meaning behind these actions. 

 

As they aged we became the recipients of their last pesewas‚Äô; these were of no value or significance to them. They are happy to see us use them to buy toffee and other sweets!. 

 

To them ‚Äú it is more blessed to give than to receive‚Äù. They were happier giving to us than taking from us. Those who are fortunate to have their grannies and grandpas alive will testify to this. 

 

As they age their needs are fewer so they give away what they consider as excess! This is a sign of the mature aged; they give instead of withholding and receiving! 

 

There is the opposite also the immature aged who is never satisfied with what they have. Their rooms are full of things they do not need but they will not give them away. They continue to ask and receive. When will they learn ‚Äú it is more blessed to give than to receive‚Äù 

 

A great lesson ageing should teach us is what Paul wrote and attributed to the Lord. That at a certain age in life, we should be givers rather than receivers! 

 

Not only should giving be limited to the material but also the spiritual and intellectual! When we are young we receive much knowledge As we age we should give back to others this knowledge! This explains why at retirement some still teach and preach. 

 

Ageing has taught me to give more than to receive because my needs are fewer. Which confirms what Jesus said 

 

Acts 20:35 

NIV

[35] In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work, we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.' ‚Äù

How I wish I could leave behind my diaries to be read by all just like he has done with his titled Ecclesiastics! I‚Äôve been working on mine for many years now! Hmmm! Eny√® easy!

 

From the two verses above he confirms what is true but often inadmissible by many. There is no perfect man on earth, we are all ‚Äú striving‚Äù and ‚Äúlearning‚Äù to be! Each one is at one stage higher or lower than the other! This is a fact of life!

 

Ecclesiastes 7:20 
NIV
[20] Indeed, there is no one on earth who is righteous, no one who does what is right and never sins.

 

You‚Äôve heard it said, ‚ÄúWhatever you do people will talk about you !‚Äù Have you asked why? This happens because those who are at your level of maturity understand and appreciate you whereas those below will condemn and speak evil of you! It is as simple as this

 

It is so because their level of understanding, knowledge and experience is lower than yours. If they wear the shoes you wore, stand where you stood, hear what you heard, and see what you saw and know what you knew ; they‚Äôll appreciate and make informed comments.

 

But quite often this is not the case  It is for this reason that Solomon advised;

NIV
[21] *Do not pay attention to every word people say*, or you may hear your servant cursing you---

 

It is not ‚Äúevery word, ‚Äú they say which is relevant some may others may not. Take the relevant and throw the irrelevant into the trash basket! In other words, do not take them to heart.

 

This calls for discernment, the ability to discern what is and what is not, and here lies the difficulty! 

To the immature and unwise everything said ( words) is relevant. So he ends up hearing his servant cursing him which makes him go mad!

 

If only we could apply the ‚ÄúSolomonic‚Äù formula and advice to tell the relevant from the irrelevant it would help us know who to listen to or not. It is not everything said by everybody that matters. 
Some things said by some matters.

 

If you want to know where this approach is more pronounced and applicable then it is the political arena. Whatever a ruling government says or does the opposition will say the contrary. Some of the ‚Äú contrary ‚Äú statements, suggestions etc will make sense others non-sense!

 

Beloved do not give ear to everything said about you, you know yourself better than they do. Listen to some, ignore others. Move on with your life, always remember people‚Äôs level of maturity informs what they see and what they say!

 

You owe no one an explanation except God! He will judge you according to what He knows about you He will not call any to tell Him anything about you.

10+ For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad.

My take.

title: Honour: What Does It Mean?

Honour: What Does It Mean?

17 The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

 

Proverbs 23

KJV

22+ Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

 

Every man or woman has two indispensable personalities: a father and a mother, persons he/she can not ignore or despise. 

 

Why is this so? It is so because his/her life depends on how he/she treats them. Divine ordinances support this statement as stated below ;

KJV

2+ Honour thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;)

 

3 That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

 

The operative word is ‚Äú honour‚Äù, what does it mean ‚Äú to honour?‚Äù  Why is this important? 

 

To honour is simply to acknowledge, respect and submit to someone regardless of social, economic, etc status. 

 

What most don‚Äôt know is that the above-mentioned (acknowledgement, respect, submission) are the prerequisites for establishing and maintaining a good relationship!. 

 

If we acknowledge, respect and submit to each other we shall have good relationships among and between us; which will result in peace, happiness and goodwill! We shall always be at peace with ourselves. 

 

If in doubt, take time to observe the type of relationship or bond  between any two persons you know, ie wife /husband; friends, colleagues at work, school etc 

 

If it is strong it is characterised by these three; if it is weak it is because either one or two of these ( or all ) are missing 

 

A relationship or bond is stronger where these are practised, acknowledgement, respect and submission to one another. 

 

So, this is what it means to honour! To have and to maintain a good relationship with anyone ( father, mother, friend etc) we must acknowledge, respect and submit to one another. 

 

This is why Paul admonished believers to submit to each other 

 

Ephesians 5

KJV

21+ Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

 

Philippians 2

KJV

3+ Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

(Acknowledgement, respect, submission is implied!) 

 

Where these three are missing here is what it leads to ;

Galatians 5

KJV

26+ Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.

 

A word to the wise.

title: A Tragedy: An Evil Under The Sun

Job 19:14-16

NIV

Job 19:14 

NIV

[14] My relatives have gone away; my closest friends have forgotten me.

 

Even his servants who waited on him when he was active looked at him like a stranger. They hear his call but will attend to him as and when they feel like. He is no longer of use to them. Yes! 

 

Job 19:15 

NIV

[15] My guests and my female servants count me a foreigner; they look on me as on a stranger.

 

This is a sad reflection of who we are and how we treat people we once adored but when they age they become despicable to us. No wonder the proverb writer said;

A sad reflection of who and what we are to the aged. May God grant us the spirit of discernment to know those who are ‚Äúfair-weather friends‚Äù whose reason and purpose for being around us is to ‚Äúuse and dump‚Äù us. 

 

My lamentations!

title: Try Again: Because You Said So!
text:
Try Again: Because You Said So!

Luke 5

KJV

5+ And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.

 

On reading this incident two important lessons stood out! 

 

Like many, I have faced challenges that nearly brought me down! I have encountered frustrations and disappointments in life ( and still do!); but the ‚Äòwhispers‚Äô of a few placed my feet firmly on the ground. 

 

My story, like yours, is not different from that of Peter, Can you imagine the frustrations and disappointments with which he uttered these words? 

Luke 5:5

NIV

[5] Simon answered, ‚ÄúMaster, we've worked hard all night and haven't caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets.‚Äù

 

Experienced as he was in the art of fishing, he caught nothing! Experienced as we may be yet our endeavors/efforts show no sign of progress. But when someone whispered words of hope victory was ours to claim. 

 

Yes, beloved ‚Äúbecause you said so ‚Äú many a frustrated and a disappointed, can stand on their feet. 

 

Let me be personal here, when I first put pen to paper to write articles, I came under a barrage of ‚Äòattacks‚Äô from some who thought they were my target of writing! 

 

Such were the ‚Äòattacks‚Äô that I almost gave up! I announced that effect at a general meeting! As soon as I took my seat two men stood up to say how beneficial my articles are to them. 

 

It is to these two men that I owe my perseverance in writing over the years. We need friends who will speak to us Words of encouragement. Unfortunately, these are a few apart. On the contrary, it is the opposite that abounds! 

 

Jesus spoke encouraging words to Peter which resulted in success; read it 

Luke 5:6 

NIV

[6] When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.

 

Many potential, gifted etc persons whose contributions be it secular or spiritual that can change the course of history and make life better for many are unable to step out because of the negative, discouraging voices that surround them. The impossibility thinkers! 

 

May we learn to speak words of encouragement to those who are undertaking tasks that will bring hope to us. 

 

The second important lesson Peter‚Äôs response and subsequent actions teach us is the need to be discerning and flexible. 

 

Peter knew who Jesus was so he was willing to act on his directive.  Some in his shoes would have turned down His directive. These will say ‚Äú We ( experts ) have toiled all night catching nothing; who are you and what do you know about fishing?‚Äù

 

Oh, we hear this said to many today. ‚ÄúWho are you to say this or that ??‚ÄùI like the word Peter used‚Äù Nevertheless‚Äù Yes, nevertheless, regardless of who or what ‚Äú I will give it a try‚Äù. 

 

Come to think of it, Jesus did not say anything Peter didn‚Äôt know. 

Read it ;

4 Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.

 

The context seems to suggest that Peter and his crew had earlier gone on a fishing expedition which resulted in nothing. So they berthed their boats and washed their nets. 

 

Read it ;

Luke 5:2-3 

NIV

[2] He saw at the water's edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets. 

 

[3] He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the people from the boat.

 

The earlier expedition brought nothing but disappointment, this explains the reason Peter said what he said. He initially doubted, he is human just like us. 

 

But he quickly discerned and was flexible in thought and decision. Here is where he puts many of us to shame probably including you!  

 

Dear reader be discerning and flexible in life After all you lose nothing by giving a suggestion a trial!

 

Discernment and flexibility are signs of growth and maturity, whereas fanaticism is a sign of the opposite. 

 

Come to think of it Jesus did not say anything strange or new.  Peter knew and understood what he suggested. 

 

Read it ; 

Luke 5:4 

NIV

[4] When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, ‚ÄúPut out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch.‚Äù

 

‚ÄúDeep Water Oooh‚Äù that was what he suggested to Peter. Something Peter knew from experience but probably overlooked. 

 

How many times have we not been reminded of something we knew but overlooked which is key to our succeeding in an undertaking? 

 

Is this not what is meant by ‚Äú Sankofa ?‚Äù  

 

These two lessons I learnt from reading this incident which I share with you I hope it helps! 

 

  1. If you have nothing positive to say keep quiet. 
  2. Be discerning and flexible in thought and decisions. You may have the monopoly over some form of knowledge ( speciality ) but certainly not over WISDOM! .

title: I Want To Know What Love Is!

1 Chronicles 11

KJV

17 And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me a drink of the water of the well of Beth‚Äìlehem, that is at the gate!

 

18 And the three brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth‚Äìlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink of it, but poured it out to the Lord,

Yes, if you want to know what love is, and if you want to know who loves you and if you want to know if it is a greater or a lesser love; then here is how to tell 

 

Oh lest I forget, incidentally the title of this article may sound familiar to some. Yes, it is that of popular secular music! 

 

Yes, everybody wants to know what true love is, for many parade themselves in front of us claiming and shouting from rooftops that they love us. How do we know? 

 

If you were to ask David what love is, this is what he would point to as love! To make a sacrifice and to take a risk for the beloved! 

 

In the above incident, David expressed a wish, but his wish became a command. Yes, when your wish(es) becomes a command to someone and he fulfils it, then it is a demonstration that you are loved by that someone.

20+ But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God meant it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.

A thought to share with you

The words of this scripture featured in one of the songs of the world-acclaimed ‚Äòsocial philosopher‚Äô Robert Nestor Marley. The Valley Of Decision! 

 

In every man‚Äôs life, there comes a moment that demands action‚Äîa decisive moment that, if left unattended, can lead to a lifelong disaster! 

 

In the Valley of Decision, we are confronted with questions that have to do with our destiny. Questions that have to do with our spiritual, economic, social etc destinies.

Every step we take in every hour or day forms part of the building blocks we lay for our future. The entire structure of the building will be completed at our old age. It is for this reason that we must weigh carefully the choices we make. 

 

It must be admitted, many of us (including this writer ) have made some irreversible choices, the consequences of which are with us today. 

 

Human as we are we can not escape such mistakes. We just have to accept and live with them till we sleep one night and wake up no more! . Though a difficult and daunting task yet we have no choice but to face it squarely   To procrastinate is to postpone what will catch up with us later

title: Self Restraint: An Essential Requirement

28+ He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

 

I  am not a chef, nor do I have any cooking experience, but anytime I taste a delicious meal I often ask to know the ‚Äúwhat‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù. The answer I usually get always points to the ‚Äúingredients ‚Äú used. 

 

I am told by the ‚Äúexperts‚Äù that for a meal to pass the test, it must have the right proportions of ingredients. 

 

I found this knowledge relevant and applicable to life. For any life to be called a good life it must have in proportion all virtues. Virtues such as honesty , trustworthiness , politeness , respectfulness etc. Most important of all is ‚Äúself-restraint‚Äù. 

 

As the above scriptures state, ‚Äúself-restraint‚Äù ‚Äú self rule ‚Äúand ‚Äúself-control‚Äù must be part of what it takes to be a good-natured man. 

 

To hold one‚Äôs spirit in check no matter what the situation may be, is more to be preferred than anything else. 

 

Read it again 

Proverbs 16

KJV

32+ He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

 

It does not take much to take a city but it takes much to rule one‚Äôs spirit. To take a city is an external warfare but to rule one‚Äôs spirit is internal which is the toughest. This explains why not many can rule their spirits! 

 

To be unable to rule one‚Äôs spirit is simply to be lacking in character, unprincipled, because character is the anchor that holds a person in check amid human storms!

 

You may have been at some meetings where there were outbursts, tempers flaring and the atmosphere was thick and tense. This is because someone failed to ‚Äòrule his spirit‚Äô! 

 

To be around people who have mastered the art of self-restraint is a joy and a delight, Conversations and discussions are conducted in a low tone!  Anything said no matter how unpleasant does not provoke outbursts, silence is maintained! Each at the meeting has learned to swallow his pride! 

 

Take note, when two people standing close to each other speak (shout) to each other in a high tone then know that they are out of sync. They‚Äôve both failed to rule their spirits. 

 

So, how do we self-restrain (rule) our spirits? It begins with self-respect which is then extended to others. 

 

The next is acceptance; to accept that all men are not the same in terms of thought and practice; there will always be differences. Make room for divergent views and opinions, speak/express yours respectfully and politely. 

 

Not everyone knows what you know, In life some are above you, while others are below in many respects. So factor this into your dealings with people. Learn from the one above you, and teach the one below you. 

 

Learn to agree, and or disagree, know what is essential and what is not.  In essentials stand firm on nonessential give way to liberty! 

 

Walk away from anyone who is lacking in character and is unprincipled! Avoid the ‚Äúnoisy‚Äù, these are vexations to the spirit 

 

Always remember, in the midst of the unwise, it would be foolhardy to be wise. As a proverb says so ‚Äú save your breath to cool your porridge ‚Äú. 

 

Always remember this; 

Proverbs 9:8-9 

NIV

[8] Do not rebuke mockers or they will hate you; rebuke the wise and they will love you. [9] Instruct the wise and they will be wiser still; teach the righteous and they will add to their learning.

 

Above all, exercise maximum self-control by putting a heavy padlock on your lips among provocateurs. Be deliberate and conscious. 

 

Finally, be patient towards all; 

Ecclesiastes 7

KJV

8+ Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

9+ Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.

 

Thoughts to share

title: The Hidden Reward:A Testimony
text:
The Hidden Reward: A Testimony. 

Galatians 6

KJV

7+ Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

 

Proverbs 21

KJV

21+ He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

 

The two scriptures above are statements, confirmations, and recommendations; they are also universal spiritual and physical laws! 

 

Sowing and reaping is common knowledge to everyone hence no need to belabor it. What is often not highlighted is the fact that not every sowing is deliberate, some are done unknowingly 

 

This aspect of sowing was brought home to me when I received a blessing from someone who said he was a recipient/beneficiary of a ‚Äúseed‚Äù I sowed.  

 

This ‚Äústranger‚Äù tried to remind me of the ‚Äúwhen‚Äù, ‚Äúwhere‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù this ‚Äúseed‚Äù was sown but I could not remember! He confirmed that yes, I was not aware of what I was doing at the time! 

 

This brought to mind two other scriptures ;

Ecclesiastes 11

KJV

1+ Cast thy bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after many days.

 

The other, the parable of the Sower; 

Luke 8

KJV

5+ A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.

 

Beloved there are many a seed we‚Äôve sown unintentionally the results of which we shall reap at the appropriate time. Be they good or bad!

 

While thinking through this encounter the following scripture also came to mind ; 

Galatians 6

KJV

9+ And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

 

God loving /fearing people will give back to us what we give out consciously or otherwise! Some in pursuit of a cause they believed to be just not to seek recognition ended up being recognised. 

 

Take the case of the ongoing activities of the group known as the ‚ÄúBus Stop Boys‚Äù. Their pursuit of keeping drainages open and clean has won them national recognition 

 

This also confirms what the writer of the Proverbs letter said ; 

Proverbs 21

KJV

21+ He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

 

That we get what we deserve as a result of what we do is a true observation in life.

 

Follow the path of evil and you‚Äôll get evil paid back to you. In the same way as following the path of righteousness, you‚Äôll get righteousness credited in return. 

 

The question then is which path are we walking, and where is it leading to? Pause for a moment to think over this. 

 

Here are a few ‚Äú follow afters‚Äù that are worth considering ;

Romans 14

KJV

19+ Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

 

Psalms 34

KJV

14+ Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

 

Hebrews 12

KJV

14+ Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

 

Whatever we sow, knowingly or unknowingly ( good or bad) we shall receive payments. 

 

A testimony to share
